W. K. KELLOGG FOUNDATION
250 CHAMPION STREET
BATTLE CREEK, MICHIGAN
HORACE B. POWELL March 5j 1959 PHONE WO S-8II8
PUBLICATIONS DIRECTOR
Dr. Harry J. Skornia
Executive Director
National Association of Educational Broadcasters
14 Gregory Hall
University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Dr. Skornia:
Last spring I made a trip to the Illinois Campus for the purpose
of observing the headquarter activities of NAEB and, in your absence,
received real aid and courteous treatment from Mr. Hill and others
of your staff. At that time we were able to obtain much information
(as well as several pictures) which we planned to use in a "featurette"
to be carried in the 1958 Annual Report of the Foundation.
Unfortunately, several featurettes had to be dropped from the final
manuscript of that particular Report because of lack of space and
we, therefore, did not run a NAEB story in the 1958 Report. Now,
however, we definitely plan to run the story of NAEB as the only
featurette in the Educational Division’s chapter of the 1959 Annual
Report. This letter, therefore, is again to ask your help in the
following:
1. Would it be possible for you or Mr. Hill to sketch for us the
highlights of the year which has intervened since I visited your
headquarters? This, of course, would bring my information up-to-
date on your activities, particularly those activities which have
been aided by Foundation funds.
2. One of the illustrations projected for the NAEB story was a
drawing or pictogram which, as I recall it, showed a radio broad¬
casting tower emanating sparks which carried the reader's eyes to
symbols of the various services extended by NAEB. One of the young
ladies in your organization sent the rough sketch of this pictogram
to me and I later returned it with a suggestion or two for its
refinement. I would hope that this sketch could now be located and
sent to us for likely illustrative use in the aforementioned featurette.
We have a May 1 date with the Foundation's Publications Committee
for review of much of the manuscript to go in the Annual Report and,
therefore, could use items 1 and 2 above as soon as you conveniently
can get them to us.
